intro: Centropogon rubrovenosus, commonly known as the red-veined centropogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red veins on its leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Centropogon rubrovenosus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
